Title: VMware AppCatalyst Lab Installer
Description:
VMware AppCatalyst is an API and Command Line Interface (CLI)-driven desktop hypervisor for MacOS that is purpose-built for developers, with the goal of bringing the datacenter to the desktop. Currently a technology preview, VMware AppCatalyst offers developers a fast and easy way to replicate a private cloud locally on their desktop for building and testing containerized and microservices-based applications. The tool features Project Photon, an open source minimal Linux container host, Docker Machine and integration with Vagrant.

Installing VMware AppCatalyst itself is very simple and easy to do. Since AppCatalyst is focused on the command line driven developer, I figured I would create an install script to stand up a complete Container Lab based on VMware AppCatalyst with the ability to leverage Docker Machine, Vagrant, Ansible and Packer.

Install Brew
Install Ansible
Install Packer
Install VMware AppCatalyst
Install Docker Client
Install Docker Machine (with AppCatalyst driver)
Install Vagrant
Install Vagrant AppCatalyst Plugin
Install Vagrant Photon Plugin

Prerequisites:
OSX Yosemite or El Capitan
Terminal
Internet Access

The AppCatalyst Lab Install can be found here on github (https://github.com/paulgifford/appcatalystlab), use the command below in Mac OSX terminal grab it with this:

curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/paulgifford/appcatalystlab/master/appcatalyst-lab.sh

Disclaimer: Use at your own risk, this has been tested on default installs of OS X Yosemite and El Capitan without any customizations.This has not been tested on the Beta or Developer Previews from Apple.
In future posts I will leverage this lab as a base to examine use cases leveraging AppCatalyst and numerous variations of Docker Machine, Vagrant, Ansible and Packer. Stay tuned for more posts.
